sen.e: This theory is based on a fact that the heads of Sakon and Yoshitsugu Otani, taisho of the 'western' army who died in the Battle of Sekigahara, were not found (in case of Yoshitsugu Otani, his close adviser, Gosuke YUASA, assisted him in committing hara-kiri by beheading him and died without telling where the head was buried, and therefore it was not found), and there were many people who said that they saw Sakon in Kyoto after the battle, but the truth is unknown.
